dmca.title: Scientist Complains to Google of Infringing Text
dmca.body:
Copyright Infringement Notification
	October 11, 2003

Google, Inc.
Attn: Customer Support. DMCA Complaints
[private]
Mountain View, CA 94043
Fax: [private]

1 -The copyrighted work that I allege has been infringed is part of the text of my publication that appears on http://www.weburchin.com/cyclase/diauxie_results.htm

The copyright for the corresponding publication is stated at two places:

(1) The Introduction page of the publication http://www.weburchin.com/cyclase/diauxie_revisited.htm 

(2.) The entrance page to the website http://www.weburchin.com/cyclase/default.htm

In the content section of the site http://www.weburchin.com/cyclase/content.htm it is stated that
"No content of this site may be copied or distributed without permission in writing from [private]"

2- The Search Query used is: weburchin 
The Infringing Web Page is http://gensum. Kaistt.ac.kr/~kspark/def/v02terms/f/fructose.html
Several sentences of my publication have been copied: First and third sentences of paragraph titled "Diauxie in fruR strains", 
Sixth sentence of "Effect of cAMP", 
First, second, sixth and twelfth sentences of "Lactose operon expression during diauxie" 
Second, sixth, seventh, eighth sentences of "Diauxie in fruR strains with different pairs of sugars".

3- My contact e-mail address: [private]@weburchin.com

4- Possible contact for infringing site,	[private]@morph.kaist.ac.kr (the introduction page of the site is in Korean)

5- I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law

6- I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

7- [private]. Ph.D.
